meanings.sent1: The cake was a veritable masterpiece of flavors.
meanings.sent2: The veritable joy on her face showed how much she loved the surprise.
meanings.sent3: His veritable excitement for the upcoming trip was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a veritable paradise of colorful blooms.
meanings.sent5: The veritable beauty of the sunset took their breath away.

meanings.definition: Used for emphasis, often to emphasize the aptness of a metaphor
meanings.sent1: The veritable storm of applause filled the auditorium.
meanings.sent2: Her veritable talent on the piano left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent3: The veritable chaos of the classroom after the party was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The veritable mountain of work on his desk seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The veritable maze of streets in the old town confused the tourists.
